Comment: It's also about opportunity.  You apparently had opportunities of which you positively exploited by means of your hard work and individual focus on your goals.  You are fortunate and I'm certain you realize that.  But not everyone has the same opportunities.  And many folks who don't still work hard, but they work in circles and just can't get the opportunity to get ahead.  While you are now a former Republican, it was a myth perpetrated by GOP operatives and elected officials that only those who embrace Republican politics work hard.  Democrats work hard, too, yet also want there to be a ladder, if you will, to rise above society's expectations, inasmuch as far too many sectors of society have a vested economic or emotional  interest in keeping certain people down.  Yet, the myth that only Republicans work hard has been metastasized to "Conservatives" only work hard, and now MAGA only works hard (which is itself a joke, since a disproportionately high number of them.are on Social Security and SSDI).  Democracy cannot succeed without equal opportunities for all.  That's the difficult challenge of a democratically elected government, which our constitutional republic has.  Without equal opportunities, we end up with tyranny, in one form or another.  You come across as a genuine patriot.  You understand the American Dream and are apparently succeeding at it.  To maintain your dream, all people must have access to that dream.  But, if it's taken away from others, especially "the other," in fascist terminology, it can be taken away from anyone.  And your hard work will end up being exploited, not by you, but by others to your detriment and everyone's.
Author: PersonalClassroom967

Comment: Throughout my career I've worked as a subcontractor with a lot of government employees.  It makes my blood boil when I hear Trump and his mouth watering zombies putting down government employees.    In my whole career I've never met a workforce that is more dedicated, hard working, and knowledgeable than government employees.   Without  government employees we have no government,  no society, and no protection. There is no over stating the importance of the jobs you do.   In all my life I'd never heard of this mysterious "deep State" until Trump ran for president. So I recently looked it up to see where it came from. This is what I found:  "During his first presidency, Donald Trump and his strategists alleged that the deep state was interfering with his agenda and that the United States Department of Justice was part of the deep state because it did not prosecute Huma Abedin or James Comey.  Some Trump allies and right-wing media outlets alleged that Obama was coordinating a deep state resistance to Trump.  Trump has used the term "deep state" to refer to the U.S. government, in particular government Institutions that "frustrate" him, as well as block or fail to implement his government policy such as courts, the Justice Department, and the news media."  I remember the first time I heard the term "deep State" it sounded like some sinister secret society deep within the government that gets together to spread evil around the world."  In other words, all the ills of society are blamed while doing a thankless jobs v  I just want you to know that you matter, your skills matter, and your dedication to your country matters.
Author: crew_you
